content.question: In an experiment, students must determine the angular momentum of a vertically rotating nonuniform disk of diameter <math alttext="1.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A central axle of negligible friction is located at the center of the disk and is oriented perpendicular to the plane of the page. A string is wound around the disk, and an object of unknown mass is attached to the string, as shown in Figure 1. The object is released from rest, which causes the disk to rotate as the object falls. The disk’s angular position as a function of time is shown in Figure 2. The tension in the string is <math alttext="5 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and remains constant. Which of the following mathematical routines could a student use to determine the change in angular momentum of the disk during a time interval <math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your selection.

choices.label: Use <math alttext="delta L equals tau delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>τ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="tau equals r F sin theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>τ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="r equals 0.5 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="F equals 5 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals 0 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>o</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use <math alttext="delta L equals tau delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>τ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="tau equals r F sin theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>τ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="r equals 0.5 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="F equals 5 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals 0 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>o</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use <math alttext="delta L equals tau delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>τ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="tau equals r F sin theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>τ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="r equals 1.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="F equals 5 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals 0 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>o</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use <math alttext="delta L equals tau delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>τ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="tau equals r F sin theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>τ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="r equals 1.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="F equals 5 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals 90 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>o</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Use <math alttext="delta L equals tau delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>τ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="tau equals r F sin theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>τ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="r equals 0.5 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="F equals 5 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals 0 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow><mrow><mtext>o</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
